Key Match Events: Tyler O’Neill hit a walk-off three-run home run in the bottom of the 10th inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Red Sox already have enough ground to make up in the American League wild-card race, and time is not on the club’s side.
Boston remains four games out of a playoff spot with 16 games to play.
Post-Match Reflections: Boston’s Tyler O’Neill celebrated after his game-winning three-run home run in the bottom of the 10th inning
The Red Sox managed to keep pace with the win, remaining four games out of a playoff spot.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was locked in a 2-2 tie going into the ninth inning
Nick Pivetta worked his way out of an early jam in the second inning
Pivetta struck out nine over six strong innings
Justin Slaten allowed a solo home run to Anthony Santander in the eighth that tied the game at 2-2
The Orioles took a 3-2 lead in the 10th on Rivera’s RBI single to score the extra-innings ghost runner
